;世界上最大的联合太阳能发电站和盐场已并入电网据其运营商称，中国有能力满足 150 万户家庭的电力需求。

;

;国有企业中国华电集团公司表示，华电天津海景电站已并入北部城市的电网周六，天津。

;

;该站由大量太阳能电池板组成，安装在超过 13 平方公里的长芦盐田上，长芦盐田是中国最古老的沿海盐场之一。

;

; “盐光互补”系统利用双面太阳能电池板产生电力和盐，吸收上方的直射阳光以及下方水面反射的阳光。

;

;中国华电表示，该站有一个装机容量1吉瓦，每年发电15亿千瓦时。

;

;该公司表示，所产生的绿色电力将有助于减少碳排放，同时不会影响盐田的环境。

;

; p>;

;国家电视台中央电视台表示，这些面板的间距比其他工厂更远，以优化能源和盐的生产，并以特定角度倾斜，以最大限度地减少水面的阴影。

;

;盐田还项目负责人杨帆向央视表示，该设施是“漂浮式光伏发电的新型复合工业模式，

;

;官方通讯社新华社称，山东省滨州市的一个养虾场在其顶部建造了太阳能项目后，年产量增加了。

;

; p>;

;据报道，产量增加是因为面板遮蔽了虾池，使水温降低了 1 至 2 摄氏度。

;

;中国华电董事长蒋毅表示，该项目增加了公司的装机容量产能超过200GW。

;

;Jiang表示，该公司正在运营其他“千兆瓦项目”，包括一座设计每小时生产600立方米氢气的太阳能制氢工厂。

;

;国家能源局政府的目标是到年底全国太阳能发电装机容量达到490GW。

;

;根据中国电力企业联合会的数据，截至3月份，太阳能发电装机容量达到430GW。

;与日本和韩国等富裕邻国不同，老龄化社会可能会这是菲律宾未来几十年面临的问题中最小的一个，使其有能力为世界提供所需的人力资源。

;

;“人口挑战不在于人口老龄化，而更多在于年轻人口。世界银行发展研究小组驻华盛顿的首席经济学家 Quy-Toan Do 在马尼拉表示，“在国内或国际上寻找工作机会。”

;

;“在未来，我们可以放心地做出预测：到 2050 年，菲律宾的人口规模仍然不断扩大，而且仍然年轻化。”他指出，菲律宾每名妇女生育的孩子数量约为 2.8 个，远高于 2.1 个替代率。

;

;随着出生率下降，菲律宾想要更少的婴儿

;

;多边机构在其《2023 年世界发展报告：移民、难民和社会》中表示，富裕国家以及越来越多的中等收入国家，传统上移民的主要来源地面临着人口下降的问题。报告称，这将加剧全球对工人的竞争。

;

;根据 4 月份首次发布的报告，中等收入国家“在致富之前就开始老龄化”，并与菲律宾政府官员、招聘人员和专家进行了讨论。周一的民间社会团体。相比之下，人口激增国家的年轻人“在不具备全球劳动力市场所需技能的情况下进入劳动力市场”。

;

;这些趋势使得有必要根据移民的情况来指导政策' 技能符合目的地国家的需求。世界银行表示，全球约有 1.84 亿移民。

;

;菲律宾中央银行预计，在稳定的收入支持下，该国的汇款（消费者支出的主要驱动力）今年和明年将增长 3%。对菲律宾工人的需求和东道国的劳动力短缺。

;

;世界银行的 Do 预测，随着人们移民和获得更好的工作，菲律宾的汇款将继续增长。然而，他警告这个以精通英语的工人而闻名的东南亚国家，要警惕来自印度等其他国家的日益激烈的竞争。 “有竞争力是件好事；主要的挑战是保持现状。”他说。

;今年至今，香港各类人才计划已收到超过10万份申请，行政长官李家超表示，这表明香港继续保持对专业人士的吸引力。

;

;香港领导人周一还强调，香港应充当国际资本和高素质人才之间的牵线搭桥。绿色项目，为国家和地区层面的行业发展做出贡献。

;

;李在香港未来论坛上发表讲话，介绍了政府吸引工人的不同计划的最新成功情况并抵消了人才流失的影响，截至 6 月底，已收到超过 10 万份申请。

;

;“这几乎是每年引进 35,000 名工人目标的三倍。这充分体现了香港对世界各地人才的吸引力。”他说，但没有详细说明有多少申请已获得批准。

;

;领导人李家超表示，香港已做好重返国际的准备

;

;去年 12 月，政府启动了顶尖人才通行证计划，降低了现有准入计划的某些要求，并在海外办事处设立了团队，吸引专业人士来到香港。

;

;Lee 上个月在华盛顿邮报论坛上表示，截至5月底，政府已收到84,000份申请，约49,000份已获得批准。

;

;香港领导人周一表示，得益于“一带一路”赋予的优势，香港作为国际金融中心的地位依然稳固。 “一个国家，两种制度”的治理原则。

;

;他补充说，在全球范围更广泛的不确定性中，香港稳定的金融体系也仍然具有高度吸引力，并指出国际货币基金组织最近的一项评估赞扬了香港的联系汇率制港元兑美元。

;

;香港将继续依托金融、贸易、航运等传统优势，同时通过创新科技、文化艺术探索新的经济引擎。

;

;他认为，绿色项目是值得挖掘的增长领域之一。

;

;“凭借金融业的优势，香港必须在引导国际资本方面发挥重要作用”由于富裕游客数量的增加和本地消费的强劲，下半年的表现将会更好。

;

;但他表示，未来经济将主要由金融和创科驱动。

;

;中央政府驻香港联络办公室主任郑彦雄在论坛上表示，香港已经度过了技术和产业变革、地缘政治冲突和疫情冲击带来的全球挑战时期。

;

;“香港的每一次崛起都是在世界变化中实现的”。 “世界的每一次变化都有利于香港，为香港带来新的篇章”

;

;香港是“增值超级联系人”，人才计划大获成功：领跑者

;

;他补充说，作为中国与世界之间的“超级联系人”，中央政府赋予了这座城市最重要的作用，这将进一步巩固其独特的地位和优势。

;

;郑应立法会主席梁君彦的邀请，定于周五与香港立法会议员共进午餐。

;周一庆祝自己 98 岁生日的马哈蒂尔·穆罕默德拒绝离开政坛尽管去年在马来西亚大选中遭遇耻辱性失败，但他还是在关键州民意调查中及时返回捍卫马来人权利，这可能会挑战他的宿敌——总理安瓦尔·易卜拉欣。

;

;在他的前门生安瓦尔上任后不久在担任多种族政府掌舵的总理后，马哈蒂尔回归了自己的政治活动主义，推出了“马来公告”，概述了该国占多数的马来族所面临的“严峻形势”。

;

;该文件已此后成为该国马来民族主义者的集结点，得到了国民联盟（PN）联盟领导人的认可，该联盟在议会中构成了强大的、完全由马来人反对的席位。

;

;两次任职作为马来西亚政坛不可撼动的遗产，马哈蒂尔面临着越来越多的质疑，质疑其竞选活动的动机，这场竞选势必会激起马来人以及马来西亚其他宗教和族裔群体的焦虑。

;

;答案已经出现观察人士称，他将成为安瓦尔。

;

;“马哈蒂尔的一方面真正关心他所认为的马来人至上主义的侵蚀，而他和许多马来人都认为马来人至上主义是神圣不可侵犯的，”吴艾说新加坡国际事务研究所高级研究员孙。

;

;“马哈蒂尔也有一面痴迷于仇恨，从而试图让安瓦尔脱离总理职位。因此，我们现在看到的是马哈蒂尔这两方面之间的相互作用。”他补充道。

;

;马哈蒂尔与安瓦尔的关系如何塑造马来西亚的政治

;

;两人之间的积怨源于1998 年，在安瓦尔首次担任总理期间，马哈蒂尔因在亚洲金融危机最严重的时期如何管理国家财政方面存在分歧，决定解雇他的副手。

;

;安瓦尔最终因以下原因入狱：腐败和鸡奸——他坚称这些指控是出于政治动机。

;

;在服刑之前，安瓦尔发起了改革运动，该运动旨在团结反对派，并慢慢削弱马哈蒂尔领导的长期执政的巫统政党的根基。

;

;周一，安瓦尔在接受记者采访时表示，他这边的宿敌也没有消退，他形容马哈蒂尔在民调结果惨淡后迫切希望保持自己的影响力。

;

;在线新闻门户《当今大马》援引安瓦尔的话说：“我要让他变得无关紧要。”

;

;马哈蒂尔也因涉嫌试图通过《马来文公告》破坏议会民主而受到调查。警方上周听取了他的供述。

;

;

;

;马哈蒂尔是一名来自吉打州北部皇家城镇亚罗士打的医生，他在去年 11 月的大选中试图东山再起，凭借新政党，Pejuang。但由于他未能捍卫自己在受欢迎的度假岛屿兰卡威长期占据的议会席位，一切都以失败告终。

;

;这位通常精通媒体的九十多岁老人在带着他的“马来宣言”重新出现之前陷入了近乎无线电的沉默。 ”其中警告说，安华新的多种族政府将侵蚀占选民近三分之二的马来人的权利和特权。

;

;“马来人已经失去了如此多的领土......[他们]将从中消失马哈蒂尔上周表示。

;

;马来人成群结队地投票支持土团党和伊党的马来民族主义联盟，因为他们对巫统几十年来涉嫌腐败和管理不善深感愤怒。

;

;马来人成群结队地投票支持土团党和伊党的马来民族主义联盟。 p>;

;马来西亚的穆希丁和安瓦尔就组建下一届政府提出了相互竞争的主张

;

;生活成本上升和 Covid-19 大流行造成的长期财政紧张也导致公众情绪恶化。

;

;随着半岛的六个州属将于 8 月 12 日进行投票，安瓦尔和他的联合政府面临着压力，需要尽其所能，至少止住马来人支持率的流失。

;

;“马哈蒂尔一直在做的是破坏联合政府的方式，”马来西亚政府事务和公共政策咨询公司 BowerGroupAsia 总监阿迪布·扎尔卡普利 (Adib Zalkapli) 表示。

;

;“他在选举中没有竞争的空间尽管在上届大选中遭遇耻辱性失败，但马哈蒂尔仍然非常有影响力，马来社区中有一些人尊敬他。”

;

;虽然政治上的东山再起可能显得牵强，但马哈蒂尔继续说道受到不同年龄和阶级的马来人的良好尊重。

;

;许多年长的企业主对他早期统治期间所获得的优惠待遇心存感激，而一些年轻人则迷恋于他的“黄金时代”

;

;

;

;马哈蒂尔长期以来一直追捕他认为未能维护马来人权利和特权的领导人。

;

;他与马来西亚首任总理东姑阿都拉曼的关系臭名昭著，马哈蒂尔指责拉曼纵容马来人和华人之间的贫富差距，官员称这是造成 1969 年 5 月 13 日致命骚乱的原因。

;

;当轮到他自己担任总理时，马哈蒂尔确保他留下了自己的印记。迄今为止，他是任期最长的总理，从 1981 年到 2003 年，他在第一任总理期间掌舵了 22 年。

;

;他被称为马来西亚的发展之父，他在任期间加速了马来西亚的工业化进程。推出了国家汽车，监督了整个半岛的现代高速公路网络的建设，并建造了吉隆坡双子塔等世界著名的纪念碑。

;

;但批评者也指责他裙带关系和寻租行为，以及不容忍异议的倾向。

;

;2003 年卸任后，马哈蒂尔继续发挥影响力，最终支持了他的另一位门徒——纳吉布·拉扎克 (Najib Razak) 的崛起。

;

;最终，马哈蒂尔和纳吉布也发生了冲突，因为这位前领导人对新政府开放市场并可能放松数十年来的亲马来人平权行动政策的尝试犹豫不决。

;

;转折点来了2015 年有关国家基金一马发展有限公司 (1MDB) 数十亿美元丑闻的消息传出后。马哈蒂尔退出巫统，一年后带领其他被解雇或退出的领导人组建新政党土团党。

;

;纳吉入狱后，马来西亚的腐败斗争最终能获胜吗？

;

;马哈蒂尔出席安瓦尔第二次鸡奸案审判的法庭听证会，然后与他的昔日对手联盟正式建立伙伴关系，以推翻纳吉布和巫统的权力。

;

;马哈蒂尔的策略在 2018 年全国民意调查中得到了回报，他第二次担任总理，尽管时间很短，但他在 2020 年的一场政治政变中倒台，这场政变是由他自己政党的马来领导人以及巫统和伊斯兰党伊党的领导人精心策划的。

;

;但他已表示辞职如此依赖他，政治就会变得“自私”。

;

;“如果我只考虑自己，我现在就不会从政了。”

; Mon, 10 Jul 2023 19:50:02 +0800 China needs process, time to heal economic scars left by coronavirus, ex-finance minister Lou Jiwei sayshttps://www.scmp.com/economy/china-economy/article/3227190/china-needs-process-time-heal-economic-scars-left-coronavirus-ex-finance-minister-lou-jiwei-says?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.10 18:33;
;;

;北京不应救助负债累累的地方政府，而应增加财政支出前财政部长楼继伟表示，需要赤字来加速中国经济复苏，他表示需要一个“过程”来治愈冠状病毒大流行留下的“伤痕”。

;

;在接受《金融时报》采访时在国家支持的《中国日报》以及上海澎湃周末发表的一篇文章中，楼继伟表示，政策制定者需要“及时”调整优先事项，以“恢复”经济。

;

;楼继伟在2013年至2016年期间担任中国财政部长，一直对中国的经济问题直言不讳。

;

;“疫情造成的创伤效应相对严重，”楼继伟说。

;

; “企业、居民和地方政府都在修复资产负债表，这是一个恢复信心的过程。只有资产负债表恢复正常、信心恢复，企业才敢于投资。

;

;“只有就业形势好转，对未来收入有信心，居民才敢消费。相应地，财政收入也会增加。”

;

;中国经济复苏慢于预期越来越受到投资者和企业的关注，尤其是中国不断增加的地方政府债务。

;

;缓解在北京考虑加大刺激力度之际，顾问们敦促加强地方债务限制

;

;一些地方当局最近表示，他们无法偿还债务，引发了人们对重大违约风险的担忧。

;

;“预计地方政府债务不会出现大规模违约。目前，夸大地方政府债务风险并向[政策制定者]施加压力的倾向正在抬头，”楼先生周六对《中国日报》表示。

;

;北京方面通过债务置换来缓解地方政府债务压力。楼补充说，地方政府债务负担是一种“道德风险”，区域经济体应该出售自己的资产来弥补资金赤字。

;

;楼还建议扩大财政赤字——政府收入的缺口与支出相比——增加 1.5 万亿元人民币（2080 亿美元）至 2 万亿元人民币用于补贴租金和水电费，以及小企业的利率支付。

;

;An annual joint air combat exercise between China and Thailand opened on Sunday to “strengthen military cooperation between the two countries and maintain regional peace and stability”, the state-run Xinhua news agency reported.

;

;Beijing's defence ministry said Chinese fighter jets, bombers, airborne early warning aircraft and ground-to-air missile installations would take part in the drills in Thailand, known as “Falcon Strike 2023”.

;

;Xinhua added that the two countries' air forces would conduct training on joint air defence, air support and large-scale deployments.

;

;An opening ceremony for the exercises was held on Sunday at Udorn Royal Thai Air Force Base located about 30km (19 miles) from Bangkok and less than 50km (31 miles) from the Gulf of Thailand.

;

;The annual drill was first held in 2015. Last year, China sent its JH-7A fighter bomber, Shaanxi KJ-500 early warning and control aircraft, and six Chengdu J-10 C/S fighters – the most advanced line-up in the exercise's history.

;

;China and Thailand to expand military ties amid 'security challenges'

;“The joint training adheres to the principles of mutual benefit and the standard of real and practical combat training, which will further improve the training level of China and Thailand's air forces,” said Chen Jun, commander of the Chinese troops, according to Xinhua.

;

;Boripat Ratchaneepun, an officer with the Thai air force's directorate of operations, added that the drill would enhance “mutual trust and friendship” between the Thai and Chinese air forces.

;

;China has been shoring up its military ties with Southeast Asian countries this year as Beijing and Washington bolster their military presence in the region.

;

;China held its first naval drills with ally Cambodia in March and conducted exercises with Singapore and Laos in May. It also took part in Indonesian military exercises off the coast of Makassar in South Sulawesi, along with the US and other forces, in June.

;

;The US, meanwhile, conducted several drills with regional allies such as Japan, South Korea, India, Indonesia and the Philippines in the first half of the year.

;

;During the Shangri-La Dialogue in Singapore last month, Chinese Defence Minister General Li Shangfu declined Washington's request for a formal meeting with his US counterpart Lloyd Austin.

;

;Thai Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-ocha has maintained close ties with Chinese President Xi Jinping in various fields, including security.

;

;Thailand was among the few countries Xi visited last year before China abandoned its zero-Covid policy and reopened its borders. ;

;Thailand will begin the first round of voting to select its next prime minister on Thursday.

;A man's headless body was found in a love hotel in Japan. He was last seen alive while entering the building with a person dressed in women's clothing.

;

;The man, identified by police as Hitoshi Ura, was found dead in a love hotel on July 2, according to local newspaper The Japan Times. The incident occurred in Sapporo, on the northern Japanese island of Hokkaido.

;

;On Sunday, near the love hotel, police officers approached pedestrians in search of evidence that could lead to the arrest of the perpetrator, according to the Japanese newspaper The Asahi newspaper.

;

;Ura, 64, was seen entering the hotel with another person at 10.50pm on July 1, the receptionist told police, according to The Asahi newspaper.

;

;Some three hours later, the receptionist was told that the person would be leaving the hotel first and that Ura would be left alone in the room, per The Asahi newspaper. The report did not state if Ura was the one who informed the receptionist.

;

;Japan's Hokkaido issues urgent bear alert after fisherman decapitated

;

;The following day, police found Ura naked in the bathroom of a guest room, where he was said to have been decapitated, The Japan Times reported, citing investigators. Police said the cause of death was haemorrhagic shock, per the report.

;

;According to The Asahi newspaper, the person who accompanied Ura into the love hotel was small in size. The person was seen wearing a wide-brimmed black hat, dark clothing, and carrying a large suitcase.

;

;Police noted that Ura's mobile phone and personal belongings were missing, per the report. On July 4, his car was found in a car park.

;

;“The investigation is progressing. We are trying to gather as much information as possible in the hope it will lead to the arrest of the perpetrator,” said Daiki Kanamori, a detective with the Sapporo Chuo Police Station, per The Asahi newspaper.

;

;Love hotels in Japan typically feature themed rooms and charge hourly rates. They are often used by couples looking for a discreet place to meet for sexual encounters.

;

;Some 4,900 love hotels currently operate in Japan, per Statista. These hotels do not require guests who live in Japan to provide identification when checking in, according to the news agency Kyodo News.

;

;Deaths in love hotels in Japan are rare – but previous incidents have been reported. In 2021, a man and woman were found dead in a love hotel in Tokyo. Police reported the woman, who was in her 30s, had killed the man, who was in his 20s. She then killed herself.

;

;In 2018, a 46-year-old man and a 16-year-old girl were found dead in a love hotel in Saitama, just outside Tokyo. Police said they killed themselves.

;

;The Japan National Police did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

;Two-thirds of applicants have been given their first choice of Hong Kong secondary through the central allocation system, a slight drop on last year, education authorities have said.

;

;Pupils will be told their result on Tuesday, but families who were disappointed might find it more difficult this year to approach their preferred schools – known as “door-knocking” – after the Education Bureau announced last week it would reduce the number of places available because of falling school rolls.

;

;The Education Bureau on Monday said 50,508 Primary Six children, 1,060 more than last year, joined the secondary school places allocation system for the next academic year.

;

;Pupils were allocated places at secondary schools in two stages.

;

;Youngsters in the first group were granted school places based on discretionary factors, such as academic and interview performance. Pupils could apply direct to any two schools in this phase and the results were released in March.

;

;Children who failed to secure a place at the discretionary stage were placed in the computer-based central allocation system, where they could pick up to 30 schools in their “school net” – catchment areas – based on their home addresses.

;

;About 66 per cent per cent of pupils got their first pick through the central allocation system, down on last year's record high of 71 per cent.

;

;Eighty per cent of pupils either received offers at the discretionary stage or their top pick in the central allocation, down from 83 per cent last year.

;

;About 91 per cent of 12-year-olds were allocated one of their two discretionary place choices or one of their top three picks by central allocation, down from last year's figure of 94 per cent.

;

;Hong Kong schools told to halve number of 'door-knocking' spots for Secondary One classes

;

;The bureau, confirming an earlier report by the Post, said last Wednesday that schools could only use one of the two places reserved by Secondary One classes for pupils who had to repeat a year to enrol children unhappy with their allocated schools.

;

;“After careful consideration and listening to the opinions of stakeholders, the Education Bureau decided that only one repeater quota in each Secondary One class can be used to admit non-repeaters starting from the 2023-24 school year,” schools were told last week.

;

;The bureau added that the new policy ensured the places would be used for their original purpose.

;

;Schools agreed the reduction in door-knocking places would help to prevent a “musical chair effect” where pupils switched schools, which could threaten the survival of some education institutions because of the decline in the pupil population.

;

;The bureau said all pupils who took part in the central allocation process should visit their primary schools on Tuesday to collect allocation and admission slips for secondary education.

;

;Hong Kong authorities plan to cut 'door-knocking' places to help unpopular schools

;

;Parents will also be notified by SMS messages.

;

;Education officials added the registration period for secondary schools would be held on Thursday and Friday.

;

;Chu Kwok-keung, the principal of a school near the border and a lawmaker for the education constituency, said the return of pupils from mainland China after all travel restrictions were dropped in February was one of the reasons for pushing down the rate of top choice successes.

;

;“After the pandemic, some students across the borders applied for Primary Six in the North district”, he explained. “As I know, more than 200 Primary Six students in our districts were allocated their secondary school places in Kowloon due to keen competition, and the number is more than last year.”

;

;Chu added another reason for the rate coming down was more parents and pupils being aggressive in their choice of traditionally popular schools as they may have thought the emigration wave meant there would be less competition.
